      • getString

        <KEY extends TypesafeMap.Key<java.lang.String>> java.lang.String getString(java.lang.Class<KEY> key)
        Return a non-null String value for a key. This method is included for backwards compatibility with the removed class AbstractMapLabel. It is guaranteed to not return null; if the key is not present or has a null value, it returns the empty string (""). It is only valid to call this method when key is paired with a value of type String.
        Type Parameters:
        KEY - A key type with a String value
        Parameters:
        key - The key to return the value of.
        Returns:
        "" if the key is not in the map or has the value null and the String value of the key otherwise

      • getString

        <KEY extends TypesafeMap.Key<java.lang.String>> java.lang.String getString(java.lang.Class<KEY> key,
                                                                           java.lang.String def)
